info.title: Bifrost HTTP Transport API
info.description:
A unified HTTP API for accessing multiple AI model providers:

• openai
• anthropic
• azure
• bedrock
• cohere
• vertex
• mistral
• gemini
• ollama
• groq
• sgl

Bifrost provides:

**Core Features:**
• Standardized **OpenAI Compatible** endpoints for text and chat completions
• Built-in fallback support across providers
• Comprehensive monitoring and logging
• Real-time WebSocket streaming

**Audio Processing:**
• Speech synthesis (text-to-speech) with multiple voices and formats
• Audio transcription (speech-to-text) with timing information
• Streaming support for both speech and transcription
• OpenAI-compatible audio endpoints

**MCP Integration:**
• Model Context Protocol (MCP) support for external tool integration
• Dynamic MCP client management (add/remove/edit clients)
• STDIO, HTTP, and SSE connection types
• Automatic tool discovery and execution

**Management APIs:**
• Provider configuration management (CRUD operations)
• System configuration hot-reloading
• Application logs with advanced filtering
• Dropped request monitoring

**Integration Endpoints:**
• OpenAI-compatible: `/openai/chat/completions`, `/openai/audio/speech`, `/openai/audio/transcriptions`
• Anthropic-compatible: `/anthropic/v1/messages`
• Google Gemini-compatible: `/genai/v1beta/models/{model}`
• LiteLLM-compatible: `/litellm/chat/completions`

post.description: Creates a chat completion using conversational messages. Supports tool calling, image inputs, and multiple AI providers with automatic fallbacks.

messages.content: What's the weather in San Francisco?

function.name: get_weather
function.description: Get current weather for a location

location.description: The city and state, e.g. San Francisco, CA

structured_content.summary: Chat with structured content (text and image)

content.text: What's happening in this image? What's the weather like?

message.content: Hello! I'm doing well, thank you for asking. How can I help you today?

post.description: Creates a text completion from a prompt. Useful for text generation, summarization, and other non-conversational tasks.

value.text: The future of artificial intelligence is
Write a short story about a robot:

message.content: The future of artificial intelligence is incredibly promising, with advances in machine learning, natural language processing, and robotics reshaping industries and daily life.

post.description: Executes an MCP (Model Context Protocol) tool that has been configured in Bifrost. This endpoint is used to execute tool calls returned by AI models during conversations. Requires MCP to be configured in Bifrost.
Converts text to spoken audio using AI voice synthesis. Supports multiple voices, audio formats, and streaming capabilities.

value.input: Hello! This is a test of speech synthesis.
The weather today is sunny with a high of 72 degrees.
value.instructions: Speak slowly and clearly like a weather reporter

value.input: This is a longer text that will be streamed as audio chunks.

post.description: Transcribes audio files to text using AI speech recognition. Supports multiple audio formats, languages, and detailed timing information.

value.prompt: This is a recording of a technical presentation about AI.

value.text: Hello, this is a test of audio transcription.

segments.text: Hello, this is a test of audio transcription.

post.description: OpenAI-compatible speech synthesis endpoint. Drop-in replacement for OpenAI's audio/speech API with identical request/response format.

value.input: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

post.description: Alternative OpenAI-compatible speech synthesis endpoint without version prefix.
OpenAI-compatible audio transcription endpoint. Drop-in replacement for OpenAI's audio/transcriptions API with identical request/response format.

value.text: Hello, this is a test of audio transcription.

segments.text: Hello, this is a test of audio transcription.

post.description: Alternative OpenAI-compatible transcription endpoint without version prefix.

value.text: Hello, this is a test of audio transcription.

segments.text: Hello, this is a test of audio transcription.

get.description: Get information about all configured MCP (Model Context Protocol) clients including their connection state, available tools, and configuration.

post.description: Add a new MCP client configuration and establish connection. Supports STDIO, HTTP, and SSE connection types.

put.description: Modify which tools are available from an MCP client by updating tool filters.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the MCP client to edit

delete.description: Remove an MCP client configuration and disconnect it from the system.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the MCP client to remove

post.description: Reconnect a disconnected or errored MCP client.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the MCP client to reconnect

get.description: Get a list of all configured AI providers with their settings and capabilities.

post.description: Add a new AI provider configuration with API keys, network settings, and concurrency options.

get.description: Get detailed configuration for a specific AI provider.

put.description: Update an existing AI provider's configuration including API keys, network settings, and concurrency options.

delete.description: Remove an AI provider configuration from the system.

get.description: Get the current system configuration including logging, pool size, and other runtime settings.

put.description: Update system configuration settings. Supports hot-reloading of certain settings like drop_excess_requests.

get.description: Retrieve application logs with filtering, search, and pagination. Supports filtering by provider, model, status, time range, latency, tokens, and content search.

parameters.name: providers
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of providers to filter by

parameters.name: models
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of models to filter by

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of statuses to filter by (success, error)

parameters.name: objects
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of object types to filter by (chat.completion, text.completion)

get.description: Get information about requests that were dropped due to queue overflow or other capacity limits.
Establish a WebSocket connection for real-time log streaming. Supports filtering similar to the /api/logs endpoint via query parameters.

post.description: OpenAI-compatible chat completions endpoint that converts requests to Bifrost format and returns OpenAI-compatible responses.
Anthropic-compatible messages endpoint that converts requests to Bifrost format and returns Anthropic-compatible responses.
Google Gemini-compatible completions endpoint that converts requests to Bifrost format and returns Gemini-compatible responses.
LiteLLM-compatible chat completions endpoint that automatically detects the provider from the model name and converts requests accordingly.

get.description: Returns Prometheus-compatible metrics for monitoring request counts, latency, token usage, and error rates.

text/plain.example:
# HELP http_requests_total Total number of HTTP requests
# TYPE http_requests_total counter
http_requests_total{method="POST",handler="/v1/chat/completions",code="200"} 42

max_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

text.example: The benefits of artificial intelligence include

max_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

oneOf.description: Structured content with text and images

content.description: Message content - can be simple text or structured content with text and images

tool_call_id.description: ID of the tool call (for tool messages)

text.example: What do you see in this image?

data.description: Audio payload (opaque string such as a data URL or provider-accepted encoded content)

format.description: Optional audio format (e.g., "mp3", "wav") or MIME type (e.g., "audio/mp3"); providers may auto-detect when omitted

max_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

description.example: Get current weather for a location

name.description: Name of the function to call
Unique name for this MCP client

connection_string.description: HTTP or SSE URL (required for HTTP or SSE connections)

tools_to_skip.description: Tools to exclude from this client

tools_to_execute.description: Tools to include from this client (if specified, only these are used)
Tools to allow from this client (whitelist)

tools_to_skip.description: Tools to block from this client (blacklist)

value.description: API key value or environment variable reference

initial_pool_size.description: Initial pool size for sync pools

drop_excess_requests.description: Whether to drop requests when queue is full

model.description: Model to use for speech synthesis in 'provider/model' format

input.description: Text to convert to speech (max 4096 characters)
input.example: Hello! This is a test of speech synthesis.

voice.description: Voice to use for speech synthesis

model.description: Model to use for transcription in 'provider/model' format

file.description: Audio file to transcribe (mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, wav, webm, max 25MB)

language.description: Language of the input audio (ISO-639-1 format)

prompt.description: Optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment
prompt.example: This is a recording of a technical presentation about AI.

input.description: Text to generate audio for (max 4096 characters)
input.example: The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog.

voice.description: Voice to use when generating the audio

speed.description: Speed of the generated audio (0.25 to 4.0)

model.description: ID of the model to use

file.description: Audio file object to transcribe (mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, wav, webm, max 25MB)

language.description: Language of the input audio (ISO-639-1 format)

prompt.description: Optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment
prompt.example: ZyntriQix, Digique Plus, CynapseFive, VortiQore V8, EchoNix Pro, CyberLeap

include.description: Additional data to include in the response

timestamp_granularities.description: Timestamp granularities to populate for this transcription

text.example: Imagine the wildest idea that you've ever had, and you're curious about how it might scale to something that's a 100, a 1,000 times bigger.

language.description: Detected language of the input audio

duration.description: Duration of the input audio in seconds

segments.description: Segments of the transcribed text and their corresponding details

start.description: Start time of the segment in seconds

end.description: End time of the segment in seconds

tokens.description: Array of token IDs for the text content

temperature.description: Temperature parameter used for generating the segment

no_speech_prob.description: Probability of no speech in the segment

words.description: Individual words and their corresponding timestamps

word.description: The text content of the word

start.description: Start time of the word in seconds

end.description: End time of the word in seconds

BadRequest.description: Bad Request - Invalid request format or missing required fields

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key

InternalServerError.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred
